Friday 17th October

10am – 1pm

[/vc_column_text][vc_video link=”https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LGdp47szmnE” css=””][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1754926074375{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]The Black Property Talks empower aspiring and established property investors with the knowledge and connections needed to build successful property portfolios. This event brings together accomplished Black property entrepreneurs, industry experts, and investment specialists to share proven strategies for generating wealth through property.

Through practical discussions and interactive sessions, attendees will learn how to identify profitable opportunities in the market, overcome industry barriers, and develop sustainable investment approaches. Whether you’re considering your first move in the market or scaling an existing portfolio, this event provides the insight and inspiration needed to achieve financial freedom through property. This is your chance to connect with a community of Black property investors who understand the unique challenges and opportunities for building wealth in the property market.

Key themes:
1. Access the tools, training, and strategies needed to accelerate your property investment journey
2. Find out how to capitalise on market trends and shifts to identify profitable investment opportunities early
3. Learn how to build a resilient property portfolio that can withstand market fluctuations
4. Develop strategic investment approaches that maximise returns and create passive income streams
5. Connect with a community of successful Black property entrepreneurs and discuss how to create positive impact through purposeful investment[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” Danielle Ashford-Quaye

Senior Sales Negotiator, Knight Frank

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Danielle Ashford-Quaye was headhunted by Knight Frank to cover five major London locations, reflecting her expertise in one of the UK’s most dynamic property markets.

Danielle launched her real estate career in 2021, drawn to residential sales by her natural love for people and problem-solving. In her second year, she obtained her NAEA qualification, showing her commitment to high standards and ethical practice.

Beyond her day-to-day role, Danielle is a rising voice in the investor and creator space. Through her platform @TheWharfAgent, she shares insights, property tours, and motivational content to educate, inspire, and connect.

Passionate about creative investment strategies like no money down and infill land development, Danielle champions mindset as key to building long-term wealth, encouraging others to push past fear and turn obstacles into opportunities.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner Shaun Davis

Founder, The High Performance Academy & Co-Founder & CEO, Erban Homes

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Shaun is a respected Social Housing Specialist, public speaker, and mentor with nearly 7 years of hands-on experience in business. Passionate about transforming lives through social impact, he has successfully built two 7-figure businesses. Shaun is currently leading a mission to house and support over 1,000 homeless individuals, using property as a powerful tool for change.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” text_direction=”default”]

Ashleigh Davis

Co-Founder & COO, Erban Homes

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Ashleigh is a highly regarded Social Housing Specialist with nearly 7 years of experience in the sector. As COO at Erban Homes, she plays a key role in housing and supporting hundreds of tenants across Birmingham. Known for her resilience and sharp operational insight, Ashleigh has overcome significant challenges and brings a wealth of expertise in both business management and leadership[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Hanna Afolabi

Managing Director & Founder, Mood and Space

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Hanna founded Mood and Space, a development company that supports clients in embedding social value in their development vision and strategy, as well as efficiently managing the processes to deliver community focused buildings and urban neighbourhoods.

Prior to founding Mood and Space, Hanna was a Development Director for Balfour Beatty Investments seconded into East Wick and Sweetwater Ltd, a joint venture with Places for People. She led on the feasibility, business planning, budget, design, programming and planning of the mixed-use regeneration project of c. 1900 homes on the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park.

Additionally, Hanna founded Black Women in Real Estate (BWRE) in 2019. BWRE is an organisation that aims to bring together black women in property, creating opportunities for upcoming talent and organising workshops for those already in the industry.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Kazeem Alli-Balogun

Property Developer & Founder, PBK Community

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Kazeem Alli-Balogun is a seasoned property developer and founder of the PBK Podcast and PBK Community. With over 10 years experience buying, selling and renovating property. After sharing his journey on social media in 2020 he now has amassed a following of over 70,000 people across social media platforms and has become a recognised voice in the property world, particularly among ethnic minorities and aspiring property investors. His podcast, the PBK Podcast, serves as a vital platform for discussing the challenges and opportunities within the property market, aiming to educate and inspire a new generation of property enthusiasts. Kazeem’s commitment to diversity and inclusion is reflected in every episode, where he and his guests explore innovative solutions to make property accessible to all.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Lee Anderson

Managing Director, LeBern & Founder, WHOMA & Genesis Club

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Lee Anderson is an entrepreneur and business leader with a proven track record of building and scaling ventures across the property and business services sectors. As the managing director of LeBern he has built a reputation of being a housing provider of decent homes to local authorities across London. As co-founder of Lebern Support Services, he has helped establish a trusted and growing family business that delivers quality residential property management solutions while creating meaningful impact for clients and communities.

Beyond Lebern, Lee is the driving force behind WHOMA, a venture designed to innovate the property space, and Genesis Club, a community that empowers professionals and entrepreneurs to connect, grow, and succeed together. Passionate about legacy-building, Lee blends entrepreneurial drive with family values.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Shereen Anderson

Managing Director, LeBern Support Services

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Shereen Anderson is the Managing Director and co-founder of Lebern Support Services, a family-led business delivering excellence in residential landlord support services. With over 10 years of leadership in the sector, she has helped grow Lebern into a trusted and thriving company, blending strategic vision with a people-first approach. Alongside her husband, Shereen has built a business rooted in family, innovation and continued improvement. A mother of two, she exemplifies the balance between professional ambition and personal commitment. Shereen’s journey highlights the importance of legacy-building and leadership.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Stuart Douglas

Property Developer & TV Presenter

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Stuart Douglas is one half of the brother/sister presenting duo taking television by storm. With first-hand experience in property development, the Douglas siblings are sharing their expertise and insight with newcomers and old hands in the housing market.

Stuart & Scarlette’s show, ‘Worst House on the Street’ achieved huge ratings on Channel 4, leading to the commission of two further series. Their new Channel 4 series ‘Can’t Sell, Must Sell’ has also aired to acclaimed reviews.

The pair’s podcast ‘Property Unlocked’ can be found on all major platforms, with a second podcast currently in development.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

James Mason

Partner, Capital Markets, Knight Frank

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

James is a senior member of Knight Frank’s National Capital Markets team, specialising in portfolio transactions and the structuring of innovative capital partnerships. With 19 years of experience in the UK investment market, he has built a strong track record in originating, underwriting, and executing complex real estate deals. Over the past 18 months alone, James has played a lead advisory role in transactions totalling over £1.5 billion, spanning both single-asset and portfolio deals across a broad range of sectors.

As well as his day job, James is also heavily involved with Knight Frank’s Early Careers programmes, which under his guidance continue to evolve to ensure the business is capturing the brightest and best talent.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Eroll-James Kpenou

Residential Market Intelligence & Valuations Analyst, Peabody

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Eroll-James works at Peabody as a Residential Market Intelligence and Valuations Analyst, providing 

strategic advice across the development lifecycle. With more than six years of experience in real estate, he has a background in finance and economics which he has taken into his passion for the built environment. He has experience evaluating real estate from both a broad market perspective and at the granular level, and is passionate about delivering properties that help people achieve their dreams. Previously a Senior Research Analyst at JLL focused on UK residential and a Research Analyst at Real Capital Analytics (MSCI).[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ text_direction=”default”]

Mosique Lavontelle

Presenter & Content Creator

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]MLavontelle is an award-winning Presenter, Host and Producer with a dynamic career spanning television, radio, and online platforms, such as Hearst UK, ITV and News UK. Best known for delivering engaging and impactful content, MLavontelle has interviewed esteemed figures such as Michael B Jordan, Trevor Nelson, Stormzy, and many others. From captivating live audiences to creating compelling stories behind the scenes, she has hosted prominent corporate and networking events such as the UK Black Business Show and worked with brands such as Google, The Financial Times and Kick Game. Over the years, MLavontelle has advocated for both Sickle Cell Awareness and Blood Donation. Whether connecting with viewers on-screen, engaging listeners on the airwaves, or producing digital content that resonates, MLavontelle brings a wealth of expertise, creativity, and professionalism to every project.  [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” top_margin=”5%”
